results.title: Leave no man behind
results.creator_credit: Les Maher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Even though Les Maher believed you should never leave a man behind, there was a time in Vietnam that he had to make the decision to do so. Decades later, Maher has never forgotten and endeavoured to fulfil his promise.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Maher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Race
results.creator_credit: Nikki Rose, Kinetoscope Productions and First Light
results.brief_description: Neil and David met at nursery school. There was something different about Neil but David liked him, even though he often got himself into a bad temper. Neil knew that because of his condition eventually they would part company but David vowed that they would always remain best friends.

results.title: The Right to be heard
results.creator_credit: Louise Hubbard, Kay Donovan and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Examines every person’s right to understand what occurs in court regardless of language. The use of interpreters is one way of overcoming this disadvantage.

results.title: Prehistoric Pet Shop
results.creator_credit: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
results.brief_description: Prehistoric Pet Shop is about a caveman whose alarm clock stops working. But not just any alarm clock - the clock was a bird with an unfortunate heart problem. The caveman goes to the pet shop to complain about his faulty alarm clock. A homage to Monty Python’s parrot sketch, this hilarious short reveals that complaining can get you more than just a new alarm clock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
results.description: Prehistoric Pet Shop is about a caveman whose alarm clock stops working. But not just any alarm clock - the clock was a bird with an unfortunate heart problem. The caveman goes to the pet shop to complain about his faulty alarm clock. results.title: Birthdays
results.creator_credit: Linda Rawlings, Michael Rogers and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Australians, from all ages, from all backgrounds, discuss mythologies and stories connected with birth, mothering and pregnancy. The video utilises the imagery of water to represent the foetal world of the womb. By contrasting stories of pain and joy; accounts from mothers and accounts from adults who have undergone re-birthing; and by contrasting different cultural experiences of birth, “Birthdays” ultimately is a testament to the crucial role, ideas surrounding birth and mothering have on forming individual and cultural identity.

results.title: 22R&SU
results.creator_credit: Thomas Lawless, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Every young man wanted to be in the airforce but it was very selective. With technical training, Thomas Lawless found that he was most needed repairing and servicing aircraft during World War II. While being thrown into some intense situations, Lawless and his team formed strong bonds that could never be broken.

results.title: Totally Gross Anatomy
results.creator_credit: Donald M. Cooper and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Our bodies are machines in motion, capable of sheer strength, complicated thought and graceful coordination all at the same time. This is due to a network of specialised systems and teams of organs that work in perfect harmony. This series investigates those major systems, using actual footage of working organs as well as clear demonstrations with everyday materials to illustrate both the way in which they function and the purpose they serve. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students.

results.title: The Brothers Karamazov
results.creator_credit: Richard Brooks, Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Avon
results.brief_description: Based on Dostoyevsky’s masterful story of greed, vindictiveness and lust, “The Brothers Karamazov” brings 19th century Czarist Russia to life in a lavish dramatic production. Karamazov, is the father of four wildly disparate sons: a sterile intellectual, the saintly Alexey, an illegitimate schemer and the feckless oldest son, Dmitri who is in love with the same elusive woman as his father. They all stand to gain an inheritance from their father and together they weave a web of intrigue and murder. A wonderfully woven tale of sin and salvation, the film stars Yul Brynner, Maria Schell, Lee J. Cobb, Claire Bloom, Richard Basehart and William Shatner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Brooks, Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Avon

They all stand to gain an inheritance from their father and together they weave a web of intrigue and murder. results.title: The Story of a thing = La Storia di una cosa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A theatrical interpretation by a community theatre group, of the experiences of Italian women migrants, and those of their daughters. Combines stage sequences and interviews to present an appeal to listen, with humour and pathos, from a section of the community which is rarely heard. Italian dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Lost wax memory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Phillip Piperides, an Australian Cypriot is a sculptor in bronze. He explains the lost wax process of casting in bronze and explains the appeal of this particular form of sculpture. Shows examples of his work in Brisbane.
